_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The devotees who have passed away in Nād: Over fifty devotees who have ended the five lower fetters
More than ninety devotees who have ended three fetters and weakened greed, hate, and delusion
In excess of five hundred devotees who have ended three fetters and are stream-enterers, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
The fate of the Magadhan devotees [dn18:: Many Magadhan devotees who have passed away
The Buddha's failure to declare their passing
The Buddha's actions [dn18:4.0]: The Buddha pondered the fate of the Magadhan devotees alone in private
Ānanda suggested that the Buddha declare the rebirth of the Magadhan devotees
The Buddha robed up in the morning and went to Nādika for alms
The Buddha paid attention and concentrated wholeheartedly on the fate of Magadhan devotees
The Buddha saw where the Magadhan devotees had been reborn
The Buddha recounted what had happened since speaking to Ānanda and revealed that he had seen the destiny of the Magadhan devotees.
Janavasabha's past lives [dn18:9.4.0]: Seven lives in the company of the Great King Vessavaṇa
Janavasabha's knowledge and hope [dn18:9: He won't be reborn in the underworld
He hopes to become a once-returner
Janavasabha's reasons for coming to see: To inform the Buddha of the fate of the Magadhan devotees
The seating arrangement of the gods of t: The Four Great Kings seated at the four directions
The Great King Dhataraṭṭha seated to the east
The Great King Virūḷhaka seated to the south
The Great King Virūpakkha seated to the west
The Great King Vessavaṇa seated to the north
The gods who have been reborn in differe: Gods Who Control the Creations of Others
Gods of the Four Great Kings
The four bases of psychic power [dn18:22: The basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm and active effort
The basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy and active effort
The basis of psychic power that has immersion due to mental development and active effort
The basis of psychic power that has immersion due to inquiry and active effort
The three opportunities for achieving ha: The opportunity for achieving happiness by living aloof from sensual pleasures and unskillful qualities
The opportunity for achieving happiness by calming down coarse physical, verbal, and mental processes
The opportunity for achieving happiness by truly understanding what is skillful and what is unskillful, and so on.
The four kinds of mindfulness meditation: Meditating by observing an aspect of the body internally
Meditating by observing an aspect of feelings internally
Meditating by observing an aspect of the mind internally
Meditating by observing an aspect of principles internally
The causal sequence of right immersion (: Right view gives rise to right thought
Right thought gives rise to right speech
Right speech gives rise to right action
Right action gives rise to right livelihood
Right livelihood gives rise to right effort
Right effort gives rise to right mindfulness
Right mindfulness gives rise to right immersion
Right immersion gives rise to right knowledge
Right knowledge gives rise to right freedom
